column4: What's typical of fonts labeled "UI"? For instance, there's "Andale Sans", "Andale Sans Mono" and then "Andale Sans UI"?
I think the "UI" ones are designed to be used for user interfaces - menus, buttons, etc.
That seems logical, but what qualities would such a font have that normal fonts don't? I mean, it makes sense, but at the same time it doesn't :)
Don't know. Compare them and see - gnome-specimen
